properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 3:17PM EST until January 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
...Icing possible Saturday night into Sunday...

.Rain will transition to freezing rain, and could become mixed
with sleet or snow, late Saturday night into Sunday morning for
portions of New Hampshire and Maine. The freezing rain may produce
ice accretions of two to four tenths of an inch.

* WHAT...Freezing rain could lead to impactful ice accretions, and
may mix with sleet or snow in central Maine. Total snow and
sleet accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of
up to four tenths of an inch possible.

* WHERE...Portions of northern New Hampshire and south central,
southwest, west central and western Maine.

* WHEN...From Saturday evening through Sunday evening.

* IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the
ice. Travel could be nearly impossible.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING
